column5: A couple of hours ago I was driving south on 11 just out of North bay when I saw a large white Ford towing a flat bed trailer with a smallish float plane on it with out wings or motor and wrapped in plastic going north,and I thought I wonder if that was Irishfield   vance
Hard to miss a 53 foot float.
With the guard rails it was has to see the trailer but SPARKLY white Fords being pushed by engine less planes are hard to miss  :rofl2:    vance

Wasn't me... Daughter #2 had me on fabrication duty. With 3 hours notice she needed a canoe holder for her boyfriends truck so they could load and go tonight. No wonder I can't get anything, paying, accomplished around here !
Wayne, that sure ain't no work of art!
Sorry Dax... didn't have time for paint!
if they cant find you handsome....might as well find ya handy?....daughter #2 must have a handsome boyfriend
so why do the curved support rods seem to be bolted not wielded or is it both and I can't see the wields on the angle iron

You know how hard it is to weld a round tube to a square tube.. I tacked them at the end and then drilled and bolted. I'd had enough at that point.  I just threw it together with crap I had in the hangar. I've had the round pipe.. welded to the 2 x 2 square tube kicking around for about 20+ years. Like they say.. never throw anything out, you may need it next week (or decade). The curved tubes.. again I have a bucket full of them. Some very expensive Norseman aircraft preformed parts... that I found a use for!
When they return Wayne,send them done my way. I,ll give it the final touches.
Hey Brian, if he had a real truck like mine with a super cab he wouldn't need the thing.. unlike the single pickup cab and short box of his GMC !
The muffler clamps make it look shiney.

They're just worm clamps... I blew the crap out of the thinner tube on the bent pipes vs the 3/16 wall main vertical tube when TIG'ng it and just wanted to be sure they get there and back without it letting go.
..and for future reference... this is what my trailer looks like loaded!

Been there done that. Usually hang onto stuff...just in case. Though sometimes I get ambitious, or stupid you might call it, and do a shop cleaning.  I cannot believe how many small pieces of trim get returned to the Home Depot...couple days ago I look at a return cart and there it was, a 1 foot piece of primed 1/4 round...something like .49 cents ! Other times 2 feet of this or 3 feet of that. I would have never ever thought anyone would return trim or even a 2x4 until my stint at the H.D. Keep it! Ya never know! I needed sme 3/4" cove one day, guess what I found a piece, had it for about 15 years, but I had it, and it was even mahogony! Can't even buy that species anymore!  Nice canoe rack Wayne.
